title: [Outpost, Eastern Corridor]
description: Iron lanterns illuminate the dim corridor from their positions between several windows with tightly closed shuttlers along the western wall.  Trickling in from the open door is the cinnamon-laced aroma of morning porridge left to simmer on the hearth, the bouquet of coffee left to boil for too long, and the sound of bakers quietly working on the next day's breads.

Sunlight streams through open windows, their shutters folded back to tack advantage of the daytime illumination, along the western wall of the corridor and they offer a perfect vantage point of the practice courtyard beyond.  Trickling in from the open door is the gamey aroma of meats slow roasting on a spit and the sound of kitchen staff bustling through the day's preparations.
